definition: to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached

sentences.english: He seconded the motion to increase membership fees.
sentences.chinese: 他附議增加會員費的動議。

sentences.english: Everyone seconded the proposal, and it was carried unanimously.
sentences.chinese: 這項提案大家都附議，並一致通過。

sentences.english: Any proposal must be seconded by two other members of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 任何提案須有委員會其他兩名議員附議。

sentences.english: The proposer, seconder and candidates must not be disqualified at the date of nomination.
sentences.chinese: 提議人，附議人及候選人在提名時必須具有會員資格。

sentences.english: A motion was made, seconded and passed to accept the resignation of Mr. Smith.
sentences.chinese: 接受史密施先生辭職的提議，經附議表決後通過。

sentences.english: The original motion has to be seconded before it can be amended in discussion.
sentences.chinese: 原來的動議必須有人附議後，纔可以再被修改。

sentences.english: I second Xiao Li's motion that we set up a special board to tackle the problem.
sentences.chinese: 小李提議成立一個特別委員會處理此問題，我附議。

sentences.english: All right, the motion has been seconded. Is there any discussion?
sentences.chinese: 很好，這項動議已經有人附議。還有其他的意見嗎？

definition: to serve as a model for others (idiom)/to be a worthy teacher
to hold a (business) meeting/to start negotiations
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to feel guilty as a thief (idiom); to have sth on one's conscience
to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
principle of people's livelihood, the third of Dr Sun Yat-sen's 孫中山|孙中山 Three Principles of the People 三民主義|三民主义 (at the time, meaning redistribution of wealth, self-sufficiency and internal trade)
